qas.question: What year did Coolie labourers arrive?
How many coolie labourers were on the island by 1818?
What was the population of the island in 1814?

context: The <a0_0>importation of slaves<a0_0/> was made illegal in 1792. Governor Robert Patton (1802–1807) recommended that the company import Chinese labour to supplement the rural workforce. The coolie labourers arrived in <a1_0>1810<a1_0/>, and their numbers reached <a2_0>600<a2_0/> by 1818. Many were allowed to stay, and their descendents became integrated into the population. An 1814 census recorded <a3_0>3,507<a3_0/> people on the island.
